Pre-Game Insights: Denmark and Switzerland meet at Parken on March 23, 2024, as part of their preparations for the upcoming European Championship.
Denmark has won seven straight games at home since mid-2022.
Denmark topped their group in Euro 2024 qualifying despite surprise losses to Kazakhstan and Northern Ireland.
Switzerland has never won away to Denmark and is winless in their last five games against Denmark.
Switzerland finished as Group I runners-up in Euro 2024 qualifying, behind Romania.
Switzerland is without a win in four games, including draws against Israel, Belarus, and Kosovo.
Denmark's squad has been disrupted by injuries to Andreas Christensen, Andreas Skov Olsen, Christian Norgaard, and Alexander Bah.
Kasper Schmeichel is set to earn his 100th cap for Denmark.
Switzerland will be without Borussia Dortmund goalkeeper Gregor Kobel due to injury.
